items.title: Talent Attraction Specialist
items.content:
Talent Attraction Specialist at WilsonHCG

Remote

Job Locations US-Virtual

Who is WilsonHCG?

WilsonHCG is a global talent solutions leader that operates on the principle of providing true partnership to its clients. Delivering business-impacting talent solutions including recruitment process outsourcing (RPO), talent consulting, contingent workforce solutions and executive search WilsonHCG is transforming its clients’ businesses through their talent. Founded in 2002, the global headquarters is located in Tampa, Florida, with the EMEA headquarters in London and Canada headquarters in Toronto. Our global capabilities span six continents and more than 35 countries. While maximizing our clients’ talent acquisition process is essential, WilsonHCG recognizes the relationships we develop lead to the results our clients realize.

Better People, Better Business.

For more information about WilsonHCG, visit www.wilsonhcg.com.

Working for WilsonHCG:

WilsonHCG has been recognized as a winner of Glassdoor’s 2015 Employees’ Choice Awards, honoring the top 50 Best Places to Work in the United States with fewer than 1,000 employees. Additionally, we’ve been recognized as a best place to work by numerous regional publications.

Our people define us. Human capital is our business, so we know it’s the people who make the difference. WilsonHCG’s team is top-notch. We strive to create an energetic and collaborative work environment to cultivate growth and innovation because that’s what leads to happy employees, and a strong, successful company.

At WilsonHCG, you’re more than an employee you’re a contributor. As an innovator in the industry, we rely on the collaborative efforts of our employees to chart where WilsonHCG is headed next. Our team is comprised of the best in business, pioneers who are driving innovation in the talent space.

For an inside look into our company culture, check out #WilsonHCGlife.

Benefits of Working at WilsonHCG:

WilsonHCG offers an attractive benefits package to employees, including comprehensive health, dental and vision plans. WilsonHCG’s 401K program is offered to employees with three months of service. Compensation is competitive and WilsonHCG offers opportunities for a bonus based on performance. WilsonHCG employees enjoy a generous amount of paid time off (PTO) available for use in their first year of service.

WilsonHCG is an equal opportunity/affirmative action employer. M/F/D/V

Responsibilities

About the Role:

The Talent Attraction Specialist provides skilled support to WilsonHCG recruitment and client delivery teams. In this critical role, the Talent Attraction Specialist will source, identify and submit prescreened and qualified candidates for a variety of positions and a range of professional experiences. As a member of the Talent Attraction team, this role partners closely with assigned clients / recruiters to develop an in-depth understanding of position requirements. Utilizing a variety of avenues to identify passive and active job seekers, the Talent Attraction Specialist is responsible for conducting research and ongoing sourcing activities to attract talent on a national level. In this role, associates will be internet and social media savvy, resilient, motivated to succeed and possess strong written and verbal communication skills. While this is not a sales role, successful Talent Attraction Specailists will exhibit sales competencies as this role requires influencing others and the ability to meet weekly submit and monthly hire goals.

The Talent Attraction Specialist primary duties include but are not limited to:

  • Execute an effective and innovative sourcing strategy to identify qualified candidates
  • Conduct complex internet searches using a wide variety of search engines, social media, direct / cold calls, networks, directories and recruitment tools and databases
  • Proactively network and build robust candidate pools for a variety of positions and locations
  • Conduct phone interviews and assess candidates against client position requirements and organization culture fit
  • Maintain strong client and candidate relationships and satisfaction
  • Update and maintain administrative responsibilities such as applicant tracking system data entry and reports
  • Participate in special projects as assigned

Qualifications

  • Successfully achieve results in a fast-paced, metrics and deadline driven environment
  • Ability to meet and exceed performance expectations and goals
  • Strong verbal and written communication skills
  • Easily embraces change and demonstrates flexibility when direction or priorities shift
  • Works well as part of a team, as well as has the ability to work autonomously
  • Basic organization and time management skills
  • Familiarity with social media
  • Bachelor Degree or equivalent work experience

Recruiter

Headquarters: San Francisco, CA
URL: https://dataquest.breezy.hr/p/6db9820c95fe-recruiter?source=weworkremotely

At Dataquest, we teach data science to a community of hundreds of thousands of students worldwide. We help students deeply learn concepts, build projects, work together, and gain the confidence they need to start new careers. Read more about our philosophy here, and read what students think here.

We’re looking for an experienced recruiter with full-cycle recruiting experience to be our first internal recruiter. We’ve been growing quickly, and with our number of open roles, it makes sense to expand our recruiting capabilities.

Ideally, you’ll have done everything from identifying talent sources to attracting candidates to interviewing and hiring. You’ll join a remote team of developers, designers, and content authors to help us attract and retain the best and brightest candidates as we fulfill our mission of teaching millions of data science students around the world.

You’ll have a high degree of input into our hiring process, and will play a major role in shaping our future team. You’ll collaborate with department managers regularly and identify future hiring needs. You should be able to attract candidates through a variety of channels, including social media networks and employee referrals.

We believe in cultivating and nurturing talent over the long term, and we’ve hired many of our former students as a result of this belief. Ideally, you’ll have experience in community management and be excited about building long-term relationships with promising students and leading figures in the data science community.

Responsibilities

  • Design and implement overall recruiting strategy based on input from the leadership team
  • Develop and update job descriptions and job specifications based on team hiring roadmaps
  • Create an online presence that attracts candidates and Dataquest students to apply for open and upcoming positions
  • Develop relationships with promising candidates for future roles
  • Prepare recruitment materials and post jobs to appropriate job boards
  • Screen job applications and schedule phone screens
  • Conduct interviews in collaboration with the rest of the hiring team
  • Assess applicants’ relevant knowledge, skills, soft skills, experience and aptitudes
  • Monitor and apply HR recruiting best practices
  • Provide analytical and well documented recruiting reports to the rest of the team

Requirements

  • Proven work experience as an internal recruiter in a fast-growing company
  • Experience building a hiring pipeline
  • Experience in community management
  • Solid ability to conduct different types of interviews
  • Ability to organize skills assessment centers (in tray activities, work samples, psychometric and IQ/EQ tests, etc)
  • Familiarity with HR databases, Applicant Tracking Systems, and Candidate Management Systems
  • Excellent communication and interpersonal skills

There's a lot of autonomy in our roles, and our goal is to help give our team the correct context and resources to make the right decisions for our students.

Working at Dataquest gives you the chance to work with a mission-focused, motivated team on an important problem.

At Dataquest, you'll get:

  • The opportunity to see your impact on the lives of our students every day
  • The chance to work with an engaged and mission-driven team
  • The chance to define internal processes and help a company scale
  • The chance to contribute to product direction and decisions
  • The ability to work remotely
  • A supportive and collaborative environment

This is a full-time remote role that pays between 50k and 65k USD per year.

To apply: https://dataquest.breezy.hr/p/6db9820c95fe-recruiter?source=weworkremotely

items.content:
Contract Recruiter at TalenTrust

Remote | Freelance

Location: USA-

Are you a rising star in the world of recruiting? Are you passionate about delivering world-class service (and candidates!) to your clients and hiring managers? Bonus points if you know you’ll thrive while working with motivated, professional, funny people who are building a great company and shaking up an industry!

TalenTrust is hiring a Contract Recruiter for our Client Services team. This position will give you the opportunity to work with companies in various industries, collaborate with all internal departments and become an important member of our rapidly growing company! This is a virtual, work from home opportunity! This is a full time, 3 month contract role with long term possibility!

What you’ll be doing

  • Collaborating with internal team and external clients to ensure search strategy and overall candidate screening is aligned with the position and client requirements and produces successful results.
  • Interviewing and being responsible for overall candidate assessment, including: prescreens for candidates who were direct sourced, interviews, client submittals, and client and candidate debriefs.
  • Engaging with candidates throughout the process to keep everyone well informed on developments.
  • Researching thoroughly the client and industry to identify trends, news, and information that will be effective in getting results.
  • Documenting all critical information in iCIMS (Applicant Tracking System) in a way that can be understood and reported on by peers and leadership.
  • Managing a substantial workload of positions and responsibilities.
  • Facilitating candidate interviews with the client, ensuring all parties have timely, accurate information about the interview meeting logistics.
  • Supporting your team and hiring managers to ensure nothing falls through the cracks while following a defined process.
  • Demonstrating excellent judgment and the ability to make decisions autonomously.
  • Learning and sharing best practices in order to support the organization in continuous improvement.
  • This is what we hope you’ll be doing, although the reality is we are a growing company so you will be doing whatever needs to happen that day, hour or minute. We can promise every day will be different and you’ll never be bored!

Don’t apply unless you are:

  • Really smart (and can prove it!)
  • Always looking for a better, more efficient way to get things done
  • A great communicator in writing, verbally, using smoke signals you name it
  • Great at facilitating productive and focused interviews with candidates
  • So organized you sometimes annoy people
  • So full of energy you are envied by the sun
  • Have strong internet navigation skills
  • Flexible (we’re thinking Gumby-like)
  • An entrepreneurial spirit at heart
  • Personally aligned with our company values (see Our Values below)

Our Values

  • Always do the right thing.
  • Be honest and act with integrity.
  • Treat each client, candidate and colleague with respect and dignity.
  • Have a passion for what you do.
  • Seek excellence.

Other important things you should have:

  • Associates or Bachelors degree preferred, or equivalent experience in recruitment or a fast-paced, client centric environment.
  • Ability to thrive in a virtual office with flexible work hours and quality internet connection.
  • Ability to effectively use Microsoft Office (Word, Excel, PowerPoint and Outlook).

PLEASE NOTE: Even though this is a virtual, home-based position, it is preferred that candidates live in the greater Denver area but not required.

TalenTrust offers a professional services approach, a proven process, and guaranteed results. Our focus: strategies to attract, retain and engage top talent.

KEYWORDS: Recruitment; Recruitment Coordinator; Corporate Recruiter; Talent Acquisition Specialist; Human Resources Specialist; Technical Recruiter

ID: 2018-3574

External Company Name: TalenTrust LLC

items.title: SEEKING FREELANCER Worldwide, REMOTE, near-total flexibility on hours. $70-100/hr. Expert Interviewer at Karat (https://karat.io) Work from ...
items.content:
SEEKING FREELANCER

Worldwide, REMOTE, near-total flexibility on hours. $70-100/hr. Expert Interviewer at Karat (https://karat.io)

Work from anywhere in the world that has a solid internet connection. Work as much or as little as you want. Work any day, any time of day, any number of hours -- you can do 0 one week, 50 the next week, and back to 0 the next week. Only requirement there is that we want you to roughly average at least 10 hours a week, or else the training/time investment doesn't make as much sense from your end or ours.

I know the above might sound a little strange, so a bit about the company for context: Karat is a Seattle-based startup that does software engineering interviews on behalf of other companies -- primarily first-round phone screens. Quickly-growing companies can spend a significant fraction of their engineers' time interviewing; we help take the load off. We've done a lot to make the interview experience better for all stakeholders that I could write whole essays about, but suffice it to say that candidates love working with us, clients love working with us, and we're well-funded and growing quickly as a result.

Because of this quickly-growing demand, we're looking to hire more Expert Interviewers. The ideal candidate is a software engineer with strong written and verbal English skills with at least a few years of professional experience. Interviewing experience would be great, but we spend 25 hours (paid) training you before you even start, so if you're strong technically and love working with people we can usually make it work :) Interviews are conducted over video chat, using a collaborative code editor.

Some of our interviewers are freelancers who use our scheduling model to backfill hours; others are full timers at top tech companies looking to make some extra cash; others have quit their jobs to work with us full time; some are digital nomads; one of our interviewers is road tripping around North America for a year and a half, doing anywhere from zero to 40 interviews each week depending on where he is and what the weather's like.

The application form is here: https://jobs.lever.co/karat/d44ab283-c7c0-4bbd-b8c3-4dc0ced6...

I know it's a pretty unique job, so if you have any questions reply here or email me at josh@karat.io and I'm happy to talk through any of it.

items.title: Senior Professional Services Recruiter
items.content:
Senior Professional Services Recruiter at Apttus

Remote | Freelance

Human Resources & Talent Acquisition 

Remote, United States

Description

At APTTUS we are looking for a dynamic Sr.Professional Services Recruiter to join our Global TA team on contract. This is not a standard Recruiting job – this is a change agent role to support our growing Professional Services population. There’s lot to be done, are you up for the challenge?

Who might you be? You are genuine. You listen to your customers. You consistently strive to make the people around you better, while making processes simpler and more effective. You’re a true partner.

Reporting to the Global Head of Talent Acquisition, can be based anywhere but will look after our global employee population for the teams you support, working alongside Talent Advisors & Business Partners in our other offices.

Location: Remote – US

Primary Responsibilities Include

  • Manage full-cycle recruiting process for Apttus ensuring a smooth and positive candidate experience while collaborating with client groups to understand their hiring needs and goals
  • Drive all recruiting programs and source top talent to build short and long-term candidate pipeline
  • Determine and partner/execute on appropriate recruiting sources such as meet-ups, hackathons, local-recruiting marketing campaigns, employee referral programs, co-op programs, college recruiting programs, social networking and targeted websites
  • Establish and maintain meaningful and effective relationships with hiring managers
  • Manage the integrity of data in the ATS you/we like clean data
  • Use competitive intelligence and industry knowledge to research and identify new recruiting channels if you like to post-n-pray this may not be for you
  • You love to source, and won’t settle for anyone but the best candidate

Desired Skills & Experience

  • Minimum 7+ years’ experience, preferably in high growth, start-up environments
  • Experience recruiting SaaSProfessional Services roles
  • Experience as a full-cycle recruiter

Other Requirements

  • BA/BS degree or equivalent
  • Ability to identify and penetrate new recruiting channels based on research and industry knowledge
  • Exceptional interviewing, communication, organizational and problem solving skills
  • Proven leadership in a fast-paced, constantly evolving environment.
  • Strong team skills, ability to establish strong relationships with all levels of an organization
  • Strategic thinker with exceptional data analysis and analytical skills
  • Exceptional written and verbal communication skills

No agencies please.

This position description is intended to describe the duties most frequently performed by an individual in this position. It is not intended to be a complete list of assigned duties but to describe a position level. Furthermore, the essential functions are listed above and reasonable accommodations will be made to meet the requirements of the Americans with Disabilities Act. Apttus is an Equal Opportunity Employer.

Company Description

With more than 300 enterprise customers and 500,000+ users worldwide, Apttus is the industry’s fastest-growing provider of Quote-to-Cash solutions. Apttus delivers category-defining software that drives the vital business process between the buyer’s interest in a purchase and the realization of revenue. Delivered on the industry’s most advanced cloud infrastructure, Force.com, Apttus’ Quote-to-Cash solutions include Configure-Price-Quote (CPQ), Proposal Management, Contract Management and Revenue Management. Additionally, Apttus’ patent pending X-Author technology enables Microsoft Office to be a user-interface for Salesforce.com with full interaction and control between Salesforce and Microsoft Office. Investors include, but not limited to: K1 Capital, ICONIQ Capital and Salesforce.com. Apttus is based in San Mateo, California, with additional offices in Chicago, London, India, Japan and Australia.

items.title: Talent Coordinator
items.content:
Since our UK launch in 2014, DICE has become the world's most innovative music discovery and ticketing platform. Fans are able to discover and find tickets to the hottest shows, club nights and festivals on the only live music discovery platform that’s built with the user in mind. Every event is handpicked by a team of show-obsessed experts.

DICE GETS FANS IN.

Some call it HR, here at DICE we call it the People Team - we're passionate about finding, growing and developing our amazing people at DICE. As a Talent Coordinator, you’ll play a proactive and cross-functional role working with all teams.

We’re looking for a Talent Coordinator who will take charge of all our coordination efforts to help scale our awesome teams. We’re recruiting globally across the entire business, spanning from software engineering and UX development through to brand partnerships and account management.

We’re on the lookout for a highly organised, adaptable, people person to support our recruitment efforts and expansion. You will be the first point of contact for anyone applying to DICE and responsible for ensuring that all DICE candidates feel valued, and receive an incredible candidate experience from start to finish.

Responsibilities:
*Effectively coordinating the full lifecycle of interviews for all DICE candidates across teams; ensuring a proactive and positive candidate experience
* Supporting the talent partner in ensuring our applicant tracking system is up to date and candidates are updated on next steps
* Manage our job adverts for all open positions, including our accounts with tools and platforms and updating our profiles where necessary
* Making candidates feel welcomed and providing them with a tour of our offices
* Working with our Creative and Branding team to create engaging content for our pages to improve our employee brand and attract quality candidates

Requirements:
* Demonstrable experience working within a people function role for 1-2 years (recruitment coordinator, HR assistant, etc.)
* Excellent communication skills, both written and spoken
* Motivated, exceptionally organised and detail oriented
* Ability to spin multiple plates - not afraid to take on multiple tasks but know how to prioritise to achieve deadlines
* Friendly, open-minded with a positive can-do attitude
* High EQ
* Creative problem solver
* Experienced dealing with sensitive information with the ability to work in a confidential manner
* Startup experience (bonus)

Benefits:
* Competitive salary
* Unlimited holiday
* Private Healthcare
* Mental Health and Wellbeing programmes
* Sanctus Coaches
* DICE Development Programme
* DICE credit to spend on gigs
* Regular socials
* Free breakfast
* We love our HQ in East London check it out "here":http://www.debeauvoirblock.com/#home

items.content:
ABOUT US

“Online business lending with the X-factor” - The Times
One of “The 9 hottest UK fintech startups most likely to be worth $1 billion” - Business Insider

We believe that finance has moved on with technology - and we’re here to make it work better for businesses. We want to help entrepreneurs spend more time on ideas and less time worrying about their cash flow.

So what makes us different? With our smart online platform, we’re making it quick and easy for UK companies to access business finance. But it’s not just about the tech. Our people are our greatest asset and one of the best things about working at MarketInvoice.

We’re a team of bright and talented people from all over the world, who work together to get things done. Positivity is key to our culture, which means we support each other and have a lot of fun along the way.

At MarketInvoice, the opportunity for growth is as big as your ambition. We challenge ourselves to learn more and to think in different ways. In fintech, things move quickly - but that’s part of the adventure.


Our values matter and as part of the team, they’ll be yours too:
#MakeItHappen | #1Team1Dream | #AlwaysBeLearning

Hear from our Co-Founder, Anil Stocker, on his favourite MarketInvoice moment: https://medium.com/@anilstocker/my-favourite-momen...



ABOUT THE ROLE

We’re looking for a Talent Sourcer & Recruitment Coordinator who will take charge of all our sourcing and talent co-ordination efforts to help scale our awesome team. We’re recruiting across the entire business, spanning from sales and marketing to data science and software engineering. In this role you’ll have the opportunity to make a lasting impact on the DNA of the company.

You’ll report directly into the Head of Talent, and work across the team to figure out the best ways to source world-class people to join us on our journey to making the business finance world a better place. We’ll look to you for practical and creative ways to identify, connect and engage with the best active and passive Talent in the market.

Leveraging your current capability and 1:1 coaching and development from our Head of Talent, you’ll become the sourcing and candidate experience expert in the company (& market!). We take real pride in hiring high performers who share our values and who want to do their best work here, so it is important that we get sourcing and the candidate experience right.



ABOUT YOU
•You can point to a strong success in sourcing technical talent through all available channels and via all possible methods. Ideally also non-technical. You can come from an in-house or agency background.
•You know boolean, and are technically adept. If not capable you would certainly love to learn how to throw up a landing page or build a journey in a marketing automation tool.
•You are brilliant at screening (remotely & in-person) and engaging the best and brightest talent in the market. You know how to build real talent communities (online and offline) and how to provide value to them.
•You get people, that they are not numbers, but the beating heart of any successful business.
•You are detailed and organised which means you can co-ordinate, influence and manage an amazing recruitment process for multiple stakeholders.
•You understand what an amazing candidate & hiring manager experience should look like and how to make sure its delivered, every time.
•You can work with senior stakeholders to deliver recruitment reports & forecasts.
•You are able to intelligently question anything, for example, is the resume pointless? (Please provide your thoughts when applying)
•You get people, that they are not numbers, but the beating heart of any successful business.
•You want to build the best Talent function in the world, no compromises.
•You can demonstrate how you add value outside of your role.


BENEFITS
•An excellent remuneration and benefits package
•Best in class share options scheme
•Regular performance review and extra options / compensation for strong performance
•Childcare vouchers
•Amazon Kindle and unlimited e-books
•Private health coverage and half price Virgin Active gym membership
•25 days of annual leave per year, plus your birthday off

Respondent

https://respondent.breezy.hr/p/944efd4722a5-acquisition-manager-online-marketplace?source=weworkremotely

Respondent is two side marketplace that is on a mission to connect market researchers with the highest quality respondents in the world.

We are an entirely distributed team and our company has been profitable since week 3. We’ve had overwhelming demand from companies like IBM, Airbnb, Uber, Microsoft, Procter & Gamble and many more, and are growing rapidly at about 18% M.O.M. We are excited to offer an Acquisition Manager position dedicated to the respondent side of our marketplace.

About the position:

We are looking for a Lead Generation expert who is a driven problem-solver with a 'get things done' mentality and strong attention to detail. This is an opportunity for a smart, driven and energetic individual who is looking to get in on the ground floor of a fast growing startup.

You will work on optimizing drip email campaigns to source respondents for market research studies. You’ll improve our respondent recruiting funnel that recruits specific audiences into market research studies. You will focus on automating or eliminating repetitive tasks and improving internal processes. You’ll turn study filling into a science – we will expect to see you making data driven decisions. You should expect a high degree of autonomy.

Day in the life:

  • You’ll check new studies that have been posted on our platform – the ones that are not filling with qualified respondents need help!
  • You will segment our external database of emails and set up drip campaigns that invite respondents to participate in paid market research studies that are a good fit for them studies
  • Your KPI will be filling 90% of all research studies posted on the Respondent platform every week – it’s a high pressure job that requires a highly productive person
  • Getting on the phone to cold call research participants for studies that are hard to fill
What you’ll be responsible for:

  • Bachelor's degree required
  • Some work experience with using marketing automation software like Sendgrid, Mailchimp, etc.
  • You’ll be required to analyze open rates, deliverability and use these insights to improve your respondent recruiting techniques
  • You will be responsible for filling research studies with qualified research participants
    • Leverage existing communities to acquire respondents:

    • Reddit communities
    • Relationships with influencers
    • Social site promotion
    • LinkedIn communities
    • Youtube creators
    Requirements:

    • Familiar with a wide range of marketing automation platforms
    • Driven to learn how businesses are built from the ground up in a high pressure environment
    • Capable of self-directed learning and detail oriented
    • Goal oriented in strategic and tactical situations
    • Excellent communication and relationship-building skills
    • Motivated self-starter who can achieve results while balancing demanding expectations
    • Ability to prioritize dynamic to do lists
    • Creativity and resourcefulness
    • Data and optimization driven mindset
    • An ability to multitask especially if we try to diversify lead generation
    • Comfortable presenting metrics and standing behind your performance
    Possible relevant experience:

    • LinkedIn Sales Nav for recruiting or sourcing contacts/clients/customers
    • Experience with customer acquisition in marketplaces particularly optimizing cost of acquisition etc
    • Past experience with internet marketplaces
    • Ability to identify and reach out to influencers, publishers, creators, bloggers
    • Diverse experience with digital and social marketing
    Job Conditions:

    • $50K base with performance bonus
    • Work remotely from anywhere on U.S pacific time
    • Flexible schedule and a goal-oriented culture
    • A solid company culture with an upbeat motivated team
    • We are looking for someone who matches our level of joy for the work we do, fits in well with our team, and elevates our game.

JOB TYPE: Long Term
3+ months

EXPERIENCE: intermediate

Contract Technical Recruiter
The Sourcery
About Us:
At The Sourcery, we're changing the way the recruiting industry works for the better. We help rapidly growing tech companies with our Recruiting-as-a-Service model, partnering with cutting edge startups to find the talent they need to quickly, and successfully scale up their operations. We’re innovating within the recruiting industry, working with exciting companies and delivering a superior experience to both the candidates we work with and the companies we help scale.

This is not just a numbers game for us, it's about giving good advice to the companies we work for and the candidates we place - we are a Talent Partner looking beyond the headcount into the future of our client’s hiring needs.

The key to our success is, and always has been, our team. We're excited about changing the industry for good and we all really care about helping candidates and companies solve the many challenges that come with recruiting and building great teams.

The Role:

The Sourcery is looking for fresh, energetic professionals to join our growing team as Contract Technical Recruiters. As the backbone of our delivery model, you will source and message a variety of candidates to help build out our clients’ dream teams. By deploying your skills in research, resourcefulness, and communication, you will master the art of sourcing and engaging candidates in one of the toughest recruiting markets in the country - the Bay Area tech market. We are not your typical recruiting agency (certainly not a contingent…), and we’re looking for team members who want to help redefine an industry from the ground up.

Looking for a chance to work with a dynamic team at a growing company or getting more involved in the tech community? If so, read on!

Things you’ll do:
Harness your tech knowledge to connect and have meaningful conversations with the engineers (software, hardware, systems/DevOps, mobile, etc.) and professionals we recruit, playing matchmaker between candidates, clients and the opportunities they have available.
Tap into your creative side to come up with innovative messages and methods of contacting candidates to get them interested in our open positions. Tweet them, email them, find out about their favorite sports team--innovation is what sticks out in the inbox!
Work with other team members to come up with new ideas, leverage resources, and share information that makes our sourcing efforts as effective and enjoyable as possible.


Our Ideal Candidate:
3+ years of work experience in a professional, team-based environment
Previous recruiting or sourcing experience--ideally for tech-focused positions in both agency and in-house environments
A technical degree from a 4 year university - preferred but not required
Previous independent, remote and/or contract work experience
Proven themselves as an efficient self-starter, and can balance that with working in a collaborative environment with a team of smart and driven people
A resourceful nature--you are able to identify what you don’t know, and can take the necessary steps to learn it
Demonstrated accountability, reliability, and professionalism
A desire to collaborate with your colleagues in a way that helps everyone grow and maximize their efforts
Skills to bring to the table to help us improve our existing processes (e.g. project management, operations, public speaking, etc.)

Bonus Points for Experience:
Previous research based experience
Previous customer service or service oriented experience.
Previous professional experience with ATS tools, time tracking tools, and modern virtual community.

Things to know:
This is a contract hourly position with a flexible weekly schedule. Our ideal candidate can flex up and down in hours based on business needs.
This is a remote role and does not require any time in the office.

Brooklyn, Remote · Full Time
Compensation

0.01%–0.01%

Available

Job Description

Apply Here:

ConsenSys is a venture production studio focused on building and scaling tools and enterprise software products powered by Ethereum. Our mission is to use these solutions to power the emerging economic, social, and political operating systems of the planet.

Our teams are busy at work building the future of identity, financial markets, commerce, the music industry, security and infrastructure, and more. To accomplish this, we’ve built out a flat organizational structure which we call the ConsenSys Mesh; a network of individuals & teams working autonomously and towards the same goal. The MeshOps team is responsible for designing and implementing “Meshocracy”, our own operational & company structure loosely based on the principles of holacracy. If you are someone that thrives in a fast-paced environment where being self-directed, determined, and resilient are a requirement, we would love for you to join us.

The Role

The Human Resources and Recruiting Coordinator is an integral member of our team! We need help telling our story around the world! In this role you will develop a solid foundation of knowledge and experience as part of a greater global team serving countless internal customers and projects on 6 continents. You will have the opportunity to build candidate relationships, and partner with recruiters, human resources and hiring managers. The ideal candidate seeks career growth within Recruiting and/or Human Resources and will provide support in many different areas. This is truly a choose your own destiny situation, and a chance for ownership. This role will grow and evolve as ConsenSys grows and incolves

Build excellent relationships across our organization
Create welcome packages and kits for new hires
Coordinate interview activities on-campus and in-house including, but not limited to, scheduling and calendar invites; interview confirmation emails; reserving interview rooms and telephone/video conference (when necessary); and candidate debrief calls/meetings
Schedule and coordinate logistics for all campus recruiting events, e.g. RSVPs, payment/check requests, calendar invites, etc.
Manage inventory for all recruiting swag and ensure all swag is readily available.
Coordinate offer letter process and as well as onboarding set-up
Provide support on special projects and initiatives
Assist with the internship program and internal events
Assist with wellness endeavors
Required Skills:

Meticulous attention to detail and strong organizational skills with proven ability to prioritize and complete projects within deadlines
Self-starter who loves taking initiative
Creative problem solver
Discreet and able to manage sensitive information
Flexibility, high energy and a positive attitude
Prior experience in a Recruiting or Human Resources department is preferred
Familiarity with applicant tracking systems, HR systems and social media is preferred
Ability to focus on the details, but also understand the bigger picture
Bonus Points:

Interest in new technology, Blockchain, and/or Ethereum
Humble, kind, and doesn't take themselves too seriously

items.content:
"ROLI is not only a learning-rich environment within your own discipline, but other team members

often make me question the world in new ways while we're eating lunch."

- Sarah Kosar, Head of Talent

ROLI is looking for an experienced, motivated, and thoughtful Internal Recruiter to join our Talent Team to help us continue to grow our global multidisciplinary team.
As a core member of our friendly and effective Talent Team, you will focus on direct sourcing our open and upcoming technical and non-technical positions, building talent pools that convert conversations into excellent candidate, brand and ultimately team member experiences. You will collaborate closely with the Talent Team on a wide range of the Talent Function including sourcing, role owner partnerships, employer branding, reporting, process improvements and more.

The Talent Team consists of our Head of Talent, Talent Manager and Talent Administrator. As a team, we believe in offering a superb candidate experience for everyone that takes part in our hiring process, whether that ends at the application stage or on their first day with us. We strive to offer an experience for candidates that is transparent and efficient as well as an opportunity for self-discovery along the way.

This role is most complimentary to someone who excels in a fast-paced atmosphere and is results driven. They will also be excited by solving challenges, building processes and bringing new people into an company and community where they will thrive.

This is a unique opportunity to grow our team and be a part of a disruptive category of music making devices we are creating called ‘Connected Music’ - a network of hardware and software, platform and developer products that will revolutionise how music is made. Join us to find more talented team members to help achieve our mission.

What you’ll do:

Develop, optimise and implement innovative methods to attract and source top talent, building and maintaining passive and active talent pools for a range of technical and non-technical roles across the business
Partner with key stakeholders and departments to understand their strategic direction and create appropriate short, medium and long term sourcing strategies to support this vision
Craft thoughtful, informative and tailored approaches to prospective candidates
Conduct phone screenings of prospective candidates sourced ahead of entering them into the hiring process
Ensure every conversation with a prospective candidate delivers a strong candidate and brand experience
Collaborate closely with the entire Talent Team on providing superb candidate and role owner experiences
Continuously develop a network of talent and industry contacts via direct sourcing as well as attend relevant meetups and industry events
Be an ambassador for the Talent Team, both internally and externally, promoting ROLI as a leading employer
Utilise sourcing and recruitment data to inform sourcing strategies and decision making
Be responsible and accountable for the accuracy of any prospective and sourced candidate data in our CRM and Applicant Tracking System (Greenhouse)

What you’ll need:

Proven experience and success as an in-house Recruiter hiring across a range of roles in a startup or fast-paced technology driven organisation
A balanced approach when screening and assessing the chemistry of a candidate’s fit for a position and their motivation alongside selling an opportunity
Working knowledge and experience with Applicant Tracking Systems (we use Greenhouse), social media and candidate platforms and hiring process workflows
An adept understanding of the current UK tech talent market
Resilience and the ability to manage competing demands, multiple searches, changing priorities and challenging deadlines with speed
Fantastic organisation skills with a methodical approach alongside a flexible attitude
An interest in sharing and receiving knowledge and feedback to grow the collective understanding and skill set of the Talent Team
An inquisitive mind and demonstrable examples of implementing proactive solutions
Excellent interpersonal and communication (both written and verbal) skills and the ability to work effectively with employees at all levels
A passion for music, technology, the arts and/or startups

Bonus points:

Proficiency in Google Suite and Apple computers
Experience recruiting at a high-growth, VC backed startup

ROLI offers:

The opportunity to work with the leading, progressive minds within technology, hardware, and music creation to directly impact the way we create and interact with music
A range of meaningful benefits including:
Generous parental leave policy
Flexible and remote work options
Wellness programme including weekly massages, guided meditation and yoga
Monthly “Friends and Family dinners”
Quarterly “Family Days”
A competitive health care cash plan
Daily complimentary homemade vegetarian lunch, as well as freshly baked bread, a breakfast bar and limitless home­made GOLDnola
The opportunity to nurture a new skill set in a 30 minute skill sharing session
A dedicated company-wide Hack Day every four weeks
2 social impact days and 20 hours per year dedicated to volunteering within the local community
A ‘Lending Library’ and generous team discount across all ROLI products
State of the art laptop of your choice and relevant software licenses for your role and beyond
A company backed pension scheme
A generous bike-to-work scheme plus in-house bike storage A competitive salary according to your level of experience

To learn more about us and our culture, check out:

Profile on ROLI Culture in The Guardian
See the Seaboard in action
Song maker kit with Marco Parisi
BLOCKS the modular music studio
Balderton Podcast - ROLI's company culture & building a unique team
Pharrell joins the team!
@ROLICareers
@CafeROLI

items.title: Worldwide, REMOTE, full time or part time -- 100% flexibility. $70-100/hr. Expert Interviewer at Karat (https://karat.io) Work ...
items.content:
Worldwide, REMOTE, full time or part time -- 100% flexibility. $70-100/hr. Expert Interviewer at Karat (https://karat.io)

Work from anywhere in the world that has a solid internet connection. Work as much or as little as you want. Work any day, any time of day, any number of hours -- you can do 0 one week, 50 the next week, and back to 0 the next week. Only requirement there is that we want you to roughly average at least 10 hours a week, or else the training/time investment doesn't make as much sense from your end or ours.

I know the above might sound a little strange, so a bit about the company for context: Karat is a Seattle-based startup that does software engineering interviews on behalf of other companies -- primarily first-round phone screens. Quickly-growing companies can spend a significant fraction of their engineers' time interviewing; we help take the load off. We've done a lot to make the interview experience better for all stakeholders that I could write whole essays about, but suffice it to say that candidates love working with us, clients love working with us, and we're well-funded and growing quickly as a result.

Because of this quickly-growing demand, we're looking to hire more Expert Interviewers. The ideal candidate is a software engineer with strong written and verbal English skills with at least a few years of professional experience. Interviewing experience would be great, but we spend 25 hours (paid) training you before you even start, so if you're strong technically and love working with people we can usually make it work :) Interviews are conducted over video chat, using a collaborative code editor.

Some of our interviewers are freelancers who use our scheduling model to backfill hours; others are full timers at top tech companies looking to make some extra cash; others have quit their jobs to work with us full time; some are digital nomads; one of our interviewers is road tripping around North America for a year and a half, doing anywhere from zero to 40 interviews each week depending on where he is and what the weather's like.

The application form is here: https://jobs.lever.co/karat/d44ab283-c7c0-4bbd-b8c3-4dc0ced6...

I know it's a pretty unique job, so if you have any questions reply here or email me at josh@karat.io and I'm happy to talk through any of it.

P.S. We're also hiring for our internal team -- particularly looking for senior engineers right now; for those we generally prefer local (Seattle) candidates, though we do cover relocation. More details on those here: https://karat.io/careers, or feel free to email me if you have any questions.

Talent Operations at ConsenSys

Brooklyn, San Francisco, Toronto, Remote · Full Time
Compensation
$50K–$60K
0.001%–0.001%
Visa Sponsorship
Not available

Job Description

ConsenSys is a venture production studio and the leading technology firm in blockchain globally. We deliver products, solutions and platforms built using blockchain technology to transform how business is done in complex network of buyers, suppliers and consumers.

Our teams are busy at work building the future of identity, financial markets, commerce, the music industry, security, and infrastructure, and more. To accomplish this we've built out a flat organizational structure which we call the ConsenSys Mesh: a network of individuals & teams working autonomously and towards the same goal. Our mission is to use these decentralized solutions to fundamentally reshape the economic, social, and political operating systems of the planet. If you are someone that thrives in a fast-paced environment where being self-directed, determined, and resilient are a requirement, we would love for you to join us.

About the role:

ConsenSys is seeking a Talent Ops who will serve as a primary point of contact for candidates interviewing at ConsenSys and will ensure the full candidate experience runs smoothly. In this exciting role, you will be primarily supporting the Talent team as well as supporting some People functions.

Responsibilities:

Correspond with candidates throughout the interview process, including scheduling phone screens, arranging and booking candidate travel, and organizing in-house interviews
Prepare the ConsenSys team before all interviews and promptly gather and share feedback with hiring managers
Create and update JDs for companies we are growing internally and various service teams within the organization
Screen candidate applications from a variety of recruiting platforms
Correspond with candidates and provide email updates

Requirements:

You have successful experience as a recruiter or as a recruiting coordinator in a quickly changing and/ or high volume environment
You're a self-starter and comfortable with ambiguity
You're self-directed and strive for a great candidate experience
You're exceptionally organized, never letting anything fall through the cracks
You have an interest in new technology, Blockchain, and/or Ethereum

Nice to have:

+Experience using Greenhouse
+Comfortable working with distributed teams

Here are some of the perks of being part of a unique organization like ConsenSys:

-The forefront of a revolution. At ConsenSys we fundamentally believe that a next generation of technologies presents the opportunity to create a more just and equitable society.
-A dynamic startup environment. ConsenSys is a thought leader in the blockchain space and we are absorbing a significant portion of the mindshare. This is both exciting and challenging, as we learn to scale our organization while adhering to the principles of decentralization.
-Continuous learning. You’ll be constantly exposed to new languages, frameworks and ideas from your peers and as you work on different projects -- challenging you to stay at the top of your game.
-Deep technical challenges. This entire ecosystem is about 10 years old. Ethereum itself is still a toddler. There is much work to be done before these platforms can scale to the order of millions or billions of users. ConsenSys is building the technology platforms that can get us to those next thresholds of scale.
